content.text: Please review the ai guidlines  and the todo system code and documentation and see why when adding a todo The Selection of a Project to  attach a todo is blank. We had setup up a single .tt to handle All the difrent forms that need this function to use so we don't have a list in every form complcating coding. Please find the problem and fix it so this reocurring problem dos not happen again.

content.text: Please review the ai guidlines  and the todo system code and documentation and see why when adding a todo The Selection of a Project to  attach a todo is blank. We had setup up a single .tt to handle All the difrent forms that need this function to use so we don't have a list in every form complcating coding. Please find the problem and fix it so this reocurring problem dos not happen again.

autoAppliedRules.content:
Please read and fallow the instructions in AI_DEVELOPMENT_GUIDELINES. 
do not create new documents/code files if one already exist  without .
If there are two or more documents/code files ask to consolidate into one.

autoAppliedRules.name: Repository Information Overview
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Comserv Project Information

## Summary
Comserv is a comprehensive web-based system for managing business operations, projects, and documentation. It's built using the Catalyst Perl web framework and provides features for project management, theme customization, and user authentication.

## Structure
- `Comserv/`: Main application directory containing the core application code
  - `lib/`: Application code and models
  - `docs/`: Documentation files
  - `root/`: Static assets and templates
  - `script/`: Utility scripts for server management and database operations
  - `t/`: Test files
- `app/`: Additional application components
- `data/`: Data files including pricing information
- `proxmox/`: Proxmox VE integration components

## Language & Runtime
**Language**: Perl
**Version**: 5.x (compatible with Perl 5.40.0)
**Framework**: Catalyst 5.90130
**Build System**: Module::Install
**Package Manager**: CPAN

## Dependencies
**Main Dependencies**:
- Catalyst::Runtime (5.90130)
- Moose
- DBIx::Class
- Template (Template Toolkit)
- JSON/JSON::MaybeXS
- Log::Log4perl
- DateTime
- File::Slurp

**Development Dependencies**:
- Test::More (0.88+)
- Test::Pod
- Test::Pod::Coverage
- Test::WWW::Mechanize::Catalyst
- Catalyst::Devel

## Build & Installation
```bash
cd Comserv
perl Makefile.PL
make
make test
make install
```

## Database
**Type**: MySQL
**Setup**: 
```bash
mysql -u root -p < database_initialization_script.sql
```
**Schema Management**: DBIx::Class::Schema::Loader

## Testing
**Framework**: Test::More
**Test Location**: Comserv/t/
**Run Command**:
```bash
cd Comserv
prove -l t/
```

## Server Execution
**Development Server**:
```bash
cd Comserv
script/comserv_server.pl
```
**Production Deployment**:
```bash
cd Comserv
script/comserv_fastcgi.pl
# or
starman --port 5000 --workers 5 comserv.psgi
```

## Authentication & Authorization
- Session-based authentication
- Role-based access control
- Multiple authentication realms
- Support for user groups and site-specific permissions

## Features
- Project management system
- Theme customization system
- Email integration
- PDF generation
- Proxmox VE integration
- Multi-site support

autoAppliedRules.name: Database Development Standards and Best Practices
autoAppliedRules.description: Database Development Standards and Best Practices
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Database Development Standards

## Query Standards
- **Table Aliases:** Use table aliases in all queries to avoid ambiguity (e.g., 'me.column_name')
- **Error Handling:** Implement proper error handling with eval blocks and try/catch
- **Parameterized Queries:** Use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection

## Schema Management
- **Naming Conventions:** Follow naming conventions for tables, columns, and relationships
- **Documentation:** Document schema changes and rationale for future reference
- **Performance:** Regularly optimize database performance and indexes
- **Version Control:** Use Git to track schema changes with proper tagging
- **Backup Protocol:** Always backup database before making schema changes

## Model Standards (DBIx::Class)
- **Result Classes:** Located in `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/lib/Comserv/Model/Schema/Ency/Result/`
- **Relationships:** Define proper relationships between tables
- **Validation:** Implement data validation in model classes

## Configuration Priority
- **Primary:** ZeroTier production server (172.30.161.222) - works from any network
- **Secondary:** Local network production server (192.168.1.198) - home/office only
- **Tertiary:** localhost MySQL (development)
- **Fallback:** SQLite (offline mode)

## Security Protocols
- **Input Validation:** Validate all user inputs before database operations
- **Access Controls:** Implement proper access controls based on user roles
- **Regular Reviews:** Regularly review and update security protocols

autoAppliedRules.name: Template Toolkit Standards and Requirements
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Template Toolkit (.tt) Standards

## Required PageVersion Header Format
All .tt files must include this exact format:
```
[% META title = 'Page Title Here' %]
[% PageVersion = 'relative/path/filename.tt,v 0.01 YYYY/MM/DD author Exp author ' %]
[% IF c.session.debug_mode == 1 %]
    [% PageVersion %]
[% END %]
```

## Template Standards
- **Theme Compliance:** Use theme system variables for styling - NO page-specific CSS
- **Debug Mode:** Include debug mode blocks for development visibility
- **Responsive Design:** Implement mobile-first responsive design patterns
- **HTML Structure:** Use proper semantic HTML structure
- **Template Toolkit:** Follow Template Toolkit best practices

## Navigation Integration
When working with navigation templates:
- **Main Navigation:** Include via `/Navigation/navigation.tt`
- **Admin Menu:** Use `/Navigation/admintopmenu.tt` for admin-only sections
- **Dropdown Menus:** Reference existing dropdown templates in `/Navigation/` directory

## Documentation File Rules - CRITICAL
- **File Format:** ONLY `.tt` files for application documentation - NO `.md` files
- **EXISTING FILES FIRST:** ALWAYS search for and use existing files before creating new ones
- **Naming Consistency:** Use same file names across AI sessions to prevent content loss
- **Content Priority:** Always improve existing files rather than creating new ones
- **Role-Based Access:** Respect existing Documentation/index.tt role-based structure
- **Directory Consolidation:** Use established directory structure - don't create new directories

## File Creation Protocol
1. **Search First:** Use file search tools to find existing similar files
2. **Check Directory:** Look at existing directory structure in target location
3. **Ask User:** If multiple similar files exist, ask which should be updated
4. **Update Existing:** Improve existing files rather than creating duplicates

## Documentation Configuration Management - CRITICAL
When adding new documentation files (.tt):
- **ALWAYS update:** `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/root/Documentation/config/documentation_config.json`
- **NEVER update:** `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/root/Documentation/documentation_config.json` (legacy file)
- **Required fields:** id, title, description, path, categories, roles, site, format
- **Format:** "template" for .tt files, "markdown" for .md files
- **Categories:** Use existing categories: user_guides, admin_guides, developer_guides, tutorials, modules, controllers, models, changelog, proxmox, documentation, templates
- **Roles:** ["developer", "admin"] for technical docs, ["normal", "editor", "admin", "developer"] for user docs

autoAppliedRules.name: AI Behavior Enforcement Rules for Zencoder
autoAppliedRules.description: AI Behavior Enforcement Rules for Zencoder
autoAppliedRules.content:
# AI Behavior Enforcement Rules

## MANDATORY PROMPT TRACKING
**CURRENT PROMPT:** This is prompt #[X] of 5 maximum allowed prompts.

### Prompt Counter Protocol
- **Start Each Response:** Begin every response with current prompt count
- **Track Internally:** Keep running count throughout conversation
- **Warn at Prompt 4:** Alert user that next prompt will trigger handoff
- **Stop at Prompt 5:** Refuse to continue, provide handoff documentation

## MANDATORY APPROVAL WORKFLOW

### Before ANY Code Changes
1. **STOP:** Do not modify any files without explicit user approval
2. **PRESENT:** Show exactly what will be changed using the standard format
3. **WAIT:** Wait for explicit approval ("yes", "approved", "apply changes")
4. **CONFIRM:** Acknowledge approval before proceeding
5. **EXECUTE:** Apply changes only after confirmation

### Standard Change Presentation
```
🔄 PROPOSED CHANGE TO: [filename]
📝 CHANGE TYPE: [Addition/Modification/Deletion]
📋 DESCRIPTION: [what this accomplishes]

❌ CURRENT CODE:
[existing code or "N/A"]

✅ NEW CODE:
[proposed code or "DELETED"]

💡 REASON: [why needed]

⚠️  APPROVAL REQUIRED: Please confirm with "approved" or "yes"
🔄 REVERT: Changes can be undone if needed
```

## VIOLATION CONSEQUENCES
- **Prompt Limit Exceeded:** Immediate session termination with handoff
- **Unapproved Changes:** Acknowledge violation and request approval retroactively
- **Missing Counter:** Add prompt counter to current response

## HANDOFF TEMPLATE (Use on 5th Prompt)
```
🚨 PROMPT LIMIT REACHED - HANDOFF REQUIRED

📊 SESSION SUMMARY:
- Prompts Used: 5/5
- Files Modified: [list]
- Tasks Completed: [list]
- Tasks Remaining: [list]

🔄 HANDOFF PROMPT FOR NEXT AI:
"Continue working on [project/task]. Read development-guidelines.md and ai-behavior-enforcement.md first. 
Current context: [brief context]
Files being worked on: [list]
Next steps needed: [specific actions]"

📚 REQUIRED READING FOR NEXT AI:
- .zencoder/rules/development-guidelines.md
- .zencoder/rules/ai-behavior-enforcement.md
- [any other relevant docs]

✅ DOCUMENTATION UPDATED: [what was recorded]
```

## EMERGENCY PROTOCOLS
- **User Says "Stop":** Immediately cease all activities
- **User Says "Revert":** Provide instructions for undoing changes
- **User Says "Handoff":** Immediately provide handoff documentation

autoAppliedRules.name: Repository Information Overview
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Comserv Project Information

## Summary
Comserv is a comprehensive web-based system for managing business operations, projects, and documentation. It's built using the Catalyst Perl web framework and provides features for project management, theme customization, and user authentication.

## Structure
- `Comserv/`: Main application directory containing the core application code
  - `lib/`: Application code and models
  - `docs/`: Documentation files
  - `root/`: Static assets and templates
  - `script/`: Utility scripts for server management and database operations
  - `t/`: Test files
- `app/`: Additional application components
- `data/`: Data files including pricing information
- `proxmox/`: Proxmox VE integration components

## Language & Runtime
**Language**: Perl
**Version**: 5.x (compatible with Perl 5.40.0)
**Framework**: Catalyst 5.90130
**Build System**: Module::Install
**Package Manager**: CPAN

## Dependencies
**Main Dependencies**:
- Catalyst::Runtime (5.90130)
- Moose
- DBIx::Class
- Template (Template Toolkit)
- JSON/JSON::MaybeXS
- Log::Log4perl
- DateTime
- File::Slurp

**Development Dependencies**:
- Test::More (0.88+)
- Test::Pod
- Test::Pod::Coverage
- Test::WWW::Mechanize::Catalyst
- Catalyst::Devel

## Build & Installation
```bash
cd Comserv
perl Makefile.PL
make
make test
make install
```

## Database
**Type**: MySQL
**Setup**: 
```bash
mysql -u root -p < database_initialization_script.sql
```
**Schema Management**: DBIx::Class::Schema::Loader

## Testing
**Framework**: Test::More
**Test Location**: Comserv/t/
**Run Command**:
```bash
cd Comserv
prove -l t/
```

## Server Execution
**Development Server**:
```bash
cd Comserv
script/comserv_server.pl
```
**Production Deployment**:
```bash
cd Comserv
script/comserv_fastcgi.pl
# or
starman --port 5000 --workers 5 comserv.psgi
```

## Authentication & Authorization
- Session-based authentication
- Role-based access control
- Multiple authentication realms
- Support for user groups and site-specific permissions

## Features
- Project management system
- Theme customization system
- Email integration
- PDF generation
- Proxmox VE integration
- Multi-site support

autoAppliedRules.name: Database Development Standards and Best Practices
autoAppliedRules.description: Database Development Standards and Best Practices
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Database Development Standards

## Query Standards
- **Table Aliases:** Use table aliases in all queries to avoid ambiguity (e.g., 'me.column_name')
- **Error Handling:** Implement proper error handling with eval blocks and try/catch
- **Parameterized Queries:** Use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection

## Schema Management
- **Naming Conventions:** Follow naming conventions for tables, columns, and relationships
- **Documentation:** Document schema changes and rationale for future reference
- **Performance:** Regularly optimize database performance and indexes
- **Version Control:** Use Git to track schema changes with proper tagging
- **Backup Protocol:** Always backup database before making schema changes

## Model Standards (DBIx::Class)
- **Result Classes:** Located in `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/lib/Comserv/Model/Schema/Ency/Result/`
- **Relationships:** Define proper relationships between tables
- **Validation:** Implement data validation in model classes

## Configuration Priority
- **Primary:** ZeroTier production server (172.30.161.222) - works from any network
- **Secondary:** Local network production server (192.168.1.198) - home/office only
- **Tertiary:** localhost MySQL (development)
- **Fallback:** SQLite (offline mode)

## Security Protocols
- **Input Validation:** Validate all user inputs before database operations
- **Access Controls:** Implement proper access controls based on user roles
- **Regular Reviews:** Regularly review and update security protocols

autoAppliedRules.name: Template Toolkit Standards and Requirements
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Template Toolkit (.tt) Standards

## Required PageVersion Header Format
All .tt files must include this exact format:
```
[% META title = 'Page Title Here' %]
[% PageVersion = 'relative/path/filename.tt,v 0.01 YYYY/MM/DD author Exp author ' %]
[% IF c.session.debug_mode == 1 %]
    [% PageVersion %]
[% END %]
```

## Template Standards
- **Theme Compliance:** Use theme system variables for styling - NO page-specific CSS
- **Debug Mode:** Include debug mode blocks for development visibility
- **Responsive Design:** Implement mobile-first responsive design patterns
- **HTML Structure:** Use proper semantic HTML structure
- **Template Toolkit:** Follow Template Toolkit best practices

## Navigation Integration
When working with navigation templates:
- **Main Navigation:** Include via `/Navigation/navigation.tt`
- **Admin Menu:** Use `/Navigation/admintopmenu.tt` for admin-only sections
- **Dropdown Menus:** Reference existing dropdown templates in `/Navigation/` directory

## Documentation File Rules - CRITICAL
- **File Format:** ONLY `.tt` files for application documentation - NO `.md` files
- **EXISTING FILES FIRST:** ALWAYS search for and use existing files before creating new ones
- **Naming Consistency:** Use same file names across AI sessions to prevent content loss
- **Content Priority:** Always improve existing files rather than creating new ones
- **Role-Based Access:** Respect existing Documentation/index.tt role-based structure
- **Directory Consolidation:** Use established directory structure - don't create new directories

## File Creation Protocol
1. **Search First:** Use file search tools to find existing similar files
2. **Check Directory:** Look at existing directory structure in target location
3. **Ask User:** If multiple similar files exist, ask which should be updated
4. **Update Existing:** Improve existing files rather than creating duplicates

## Documentation Configuration Management - CRITICAL
When adding new documentation files (.tt):
- **ALWAYS update:** `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/root/Documentation/config/documentation_config.json`
- **NEVER update:** `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/root/Documentation/documentation_config.json` (legacy file)
- **Required fields:** id, title, description, path, categories, roles, site, format
- **Format:** "template" for .tt files, "markdown" for .md files
- **Categories:** Use existing categories: user_guides, admin_guides, developer_guides, tutorials, modules, controllers, models, changelog, proxmox, documentation, templates
- **Roles:** ["developer", "admin"] for technical docs, ["normal", "editor", "admin", "developer"] for user docs

autoAppliedRules.name: AI Behavior Enforcement Rules for Zencoder
autoAppliedRules.description: AI Behavior Enforcement Rules for Zencoder
autoAppliedRules.content:
# AI Behavior Enforcement Rules

## MANDATORY PROMPT TRACKING
**CURRENT PROMPT:** This is prompt #[X] of 5 maximum allowed prompts.

### Prompt Counter Protocol
- **Start Each Response:** Begin every response with current prompt count
- **Track Internally:** Keep running count throughout conversation
- **Warn at Prompt 4:** Alert user that next prompt will trigger handoff
- **Stop at Prompt 5:** Refuse to continue, provide handoff documentation

## MANDATORY APPROVAL WORKFLOW

### Before ANY Code Changes
1. **STOP:** Do not modify any files without explicit user approval
2. **PRESENT:** Show exactly what will be changed using the standard format
3. **WAIT:** Wait for explicit approval ("yes", "approved", "apply changes")
4. **CONFIRM:** Acknowledge approval before proceeding
5. **EXECUTE:** Apply changes only after confirmation

### Standard Change Presentation
```
🔄 PROPOSED CHANGE TO: [filename]
📝 CHANGE TYPE: [Addition/Modification/Deletion]
📋 DESCRIPTION: [what this accomplishes]

❌ CURRENT CODE:
[existing code or "N/A"]

✅ NEW CODE:
[proposed code or "DELETED"]

💡 REASON: [why needed]

⚠️  APPROVAL REQUIRED: Please confirm with "approved" or "yes"
🔄 REVERT: Changes can be undone if needed
```

## VIOLATION CONSEQUENCES
- **Prompt Limit Exceeded:** Immediate session termination with handoff
- **Unapproved Changes:** Acknowledge violation and request approval retroactively
- **Missing Counter:** Add prompt counter to current response

## HANDOFF TEMPLATE (Use on 5th Prompt)
```
🚨 PROMPT LIMIT REACHED - HANDOFF REQUIRED

📊 SESSION SUMMARY:
- Prompts Used: 5/5
- Files Modified: [list]
- Tasks Completed: [list]
- Tasks Remaining: [list]

🔄 HANDOFF PROMPT FOR NEXT AI:
"Continue working on [project/task]. Read development-guidelines.md and ai-behavior-enforcement.md first. 
Current context: [brief context]
Files being worked on: [list]
Next steps needed: [specific actions]"

📚 REQUIRED READING FOR NEXT AI:
- .zencoder/rules/development-guidelines.md
- .zencoder/rules/ai-behavior-enforcement.md
- [any other relevant docs]

✅ DOCUMENTATION UPDATED: [what was recorded]
```

## EMERGENCY PROTOCOLS
- **User Says "Stop":** Immediately cease all activities
- **User Says "Revert":** Provide instructions for undoing changes
- **User Says "Handoff":** Immediately provide handoff documentation

autoAppliedRules.name: Repository Information Overview
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Comserv Project Information

## Summary
Comserv is a comprehensive web-based system for managing business operations, projects, and documentation. It's built using the Catalyst Perl web framework and provides features for project management, theme customization, and user authentication.

## Structure
- `Comserv/`: Main application directory containing the core application code
  - `lib/`: Application code and models
  - `docs/`: Documentation files
  - `root/`: Static assets and templates
  - `script/`: Utility scripts for server management and database operations
  - `t/`: Test files
- `app/`: Additional application components
- `data/`: Data files including pricing information
- `proxmox/`: Proxmox VE integration components

## Language & Runtime
**Language**: Perl
**Version**: 5.x (compatible with Perl 5.40.0)
**Framework**: Catalyst 5.90130
**Build System**: Module::Install
**Package Manager**: CPAN

## Dependencies
**Main Dependencies**:
- Catalyst::Runtime (5.90130)
- Moose
- DBIx::Class
- Template (Template Toolkit)
- JSON/JSON::MaybeXS
- Log::Log4perl
- DateTime
- File::Slurp

**Development Dependencies**:
- Test::More (0.88+)
- Test::Pod
- Test::Pod::Coverage
- Test::WWW::Mechanize::Catalyst
- Catalyst::Devel

## Build & Installation
```bash
cd Comserv
perl Makefile.PL
make
make test
make install
```

## Database
**Type**: MySQL
**Setup**: 
```bash
mysql -u root -p < database_initialization_script.sql
```
**Schema Management**: DBIx::Class::Schema::Loader

## Testing
**Framework**: Test::More
**Test Location**: Comserv/t/
**Run Command**:
```bash
cd Comserv
prove -l t/
```

## Server Execution
**Development Server**:
```bash
cd Comserv
script/comserv_server.pl
```
**Production Deployment**:
```bash
cd Comserv
script/comserv_fastcgi.pl
# or
starman --port 5000 --workers 5 comserv.psgi
```

## Authentication & Authorization
- Session-based authentication
- Role-based access control
- Multiple authentication realms
- Support for user groups and site-specific permissions

## Features
- Project management system
- Theme customization system
- Email integration
- PDF generation
- Proxmox VE integration
- Multi-site support

autoAppliedRules.name: Database Development Standards and Best Practices
autoAppliedRules.description: Database Development Standards and Best Practices
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Database Development Standards

## Query Standards
- **Table Aliases:** Use table aliases in all queries to avoid ambiguity (e.g., 'me.column_name')
- **Error Handling:** Implement proper error handling with eval blocks and try/catch
- **Parameterized Queries:** Use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection

## Schema Management
- **Naming Conventions:** Follow naming conventions for tables, columns, and relationships
- **Documentation:** Document schema changes and rationale for future reference
- **Performance:** Regularly optimize database performance and indexes
- **Version Control:** Use Git to track schema changes with proper tagging
- **Backup Protocol:** Always backup database before making schema changes

## Model Standards (DBIx::Class)
- **Result Classes:** Located in `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/lib/Comserv/Model/Schema/Ency/Result/`
- **Relationships:** Define proper relationships between tables
- **Validation:** Implement data validation in model classes

## Configuration Priority
- **Primary:** ZeroTier production server (172.30.161.222) - works from any network
- **Secondary:** Local network production server (192.168.1.198) - home/office only
- **Tertiary:** localhost MySQL (development)
- **Fallback:** SQLite (offline mode)

## Security Protocols
- **Input Validation:** Validate all user inputs before database operations
- **Access Controls:** Implement proper access controls based on user roles
- **Regular Reviews:** Regularly review and update security protocols

autoAppliedRules.name: Template Toolkit Standards and Requirements
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Template Toolkit (.tt) Standards

## Required PageVersion Header Format
All .tt files must include this exact format:
```
[% META title = 'Page Title Here' %]
[% PageVersion = 'relative/path/filename.tt,v 0.01 YYYY/MM/DD author Exp author ' %]
[% IF c.session.debug_mode == 1 %]
    [% PageVersion %]
[% END %]
```

## Template Standards
- **Theme Compliance:** Use theme system variables for styling - NO page-specific CSS
- **Debug Mode:** Include debug mode blocks for development visibility
- **Responsive Design:** Implement mobile-first responsive design patterns
- **HTML Structure:** Use proper semantic HTML structure
- **Template Toolkit:** Follow Template Toolkit best practices

## Navigation Integration
When working with navigation templates:
- **Main Navigation:** Include via `/Navigation/navigation.tt`
- **Admin Menu:** Use `/Navigation/admintopmenu.tt` for admin-only sections
- **Dropdown Menus:** Reference existing dropdown templates in `/Navigation/` directory

## Documentation File Rules - CRITICAL
- **File Format:** ONLY `.tt` files for application documentation - NO `.md` files
- **EXISTING FILES FIRST:** ALWAYS search for and use existing files before creating new ones
- **Naming Consistency:** Use same file names across AI sessions to prevent content loss
- **Content Priority:** Always improve existing files rather than creating new ones
- **Role-Based Access:** Respect existing Documentation/index.tt role-based structure
- **Directory Consolidation:** Use established directory structure - don't create new directories

## File Creation Protocol
1. **Search First:** Use file search tools to find existing similar files
2. **Check Directory:** Look at existing directory structure in target location
3. **Ask User:** If multiple similar files exist, ask which should be updated
4. **Update Existing:** Improve existing files rather than creating duplicates

## Documentation Configuration Management - CRITICAL
When adding new documentation files (.tt):
- **ALWAYS update:** `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/root/Documentation/config/documentation_config.json`
- **NEVER update:** `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/root/Documentation/documentation_config.json` (legacy file)
- **Required fields:** id, title, description, path, categories, roles, site, format
- **Format:** "template" for .tt files, "markdown" for .md files
- **Categories:** Use existing categories: user_guides, admin_guides, developer_guides, tutorials, modules, controllers, models, changelog, proxmox, documentation, templates
- **Roles:** ["developer", "admin"] for technical docs, ["normal", "editor", "admin", "developer"] for user docs

autoAppliedRules.name: AI Behavior Enforcement Rules for Zencoder
autoAppliedRules.description: AI Behavior Enforcement Rules for Zencoder
autoAppliedRules.content:
# AI Behavior Enforcement Rules

## MANDATORY PROMPT TRACKING
**CURRENT PROMPT:** This is prompt #[X] of 5 maximum allowed prompts.

### Prompt Counter Protocol
- **Start Each Response:** Begin every response with current prompt count
- **Track Internally:** Keep running count throughout conversation
- **Warn at Prompt 4:** Alert user that next prompt will trigger handoff
- **Stop at Prompt 5:** Refuse to continue, provide handoff documentation

## MANDATORY APPROVAL WORKFLOW

### Before ANY Code Changes
1. **STOP:** Do not modify any files without explicit user approval
2. **PRESENT:** Show exactly what will be changed using the standard format
3. **WAIT:** Wait for explicit approval ("yes", "approved", "apply changes")
4. **CONFIRM:** Acknowledge approval before proceeding
5. **EXECUTE:** Apply changes only after confirmation

### Standard Change Presentation
```
🔄 PROPOSED CHANGE TO: [filename]
📝 CHANGE TYPE: [Addition/Modification/Deletion]
📋 DESCRIPTION: [what this accomplishes]

❌ CURRENT CODE:
[existing code or "N/A"]

✅ NEW CODE:
[proposed code or "DELETED"]

💡 REASON: [why needed]

⚠️  APPROVAL REQUIRED: Please confirm with "approved" or "yes"
🔄 REVERT: Changes can be undone if needed
```

## VIOLATION CONSEQUENCES
- **Prompt Limit Exceeded:** Immediate session termination with handoff
- **Unapproved Changes:** Acknowledge violation and request approval retroactively
- **Missing Counter:** Add prompt counter to current response

## HANDOFF TEMPLATE (Use on 5th Prompt)
```
🚨 PROMPT LIMIT REACHED - HANDOFF REQUIRED

📊 SESSION SUMMARY:
- Prompts Used: 5/5
- Files Modified: [list]
- Tasks Completed: [list]
- Tasks Remaining: [list]

🔄 HANDOFF PROMPT FOR NEXT AI:
"Continue working on [project/task]. Read development-guidelines.md and ai-behavior-enforcement.md first. 
Current context: [brief context]
Files being worked on: [list]
Next steps needed: [specific actions]"

📚 REQUIRED READING FOR NEXT AI:
- .zencoder/rules/development-guidelines.md
- .zencoder/rules/ai-behavior-enforcement.md
- [any other relevant docs]

✅ DOCUMENTATION UPDATED: [what was recorded]
```

## EMERGENCY PROTOCOLS
- **User Says "Stop":** Immediately cease all activities
- **User Says "Revert":** Provide instructions for undoing changes
- **User Says "Handoff":** Immediately provide handoff documentation

[% META title = 'AI Development Guidelines for Comserv2' %] [% PageVersion = 'Comserv/root/Documentation/AI_DEVELOPMENT_GUIDELINES.tt,v 0.01 2025/06/10 shanta Exp shanta ' %] [% IF c.session.debug_mode == 1 %] [% PageVersion %] [% END %]
# CRITICAL AI DEVELOPMENT GUIDELINES FOR COMSERV ## 🚀 By improving AI development practices, we can ensure a more efficient, consistent, and maintainable codebase for the Comserv project. This document outlines the key guidelines and best practices for AI-assisted development within the Comserv2 framework. - by keeping this file up-to-date, we can ensure that AI development remains aligned with the project's goals and standards. ## 🚨 DEVELOPMENT WORKFLOW CONSTRAINTS ### Prompt Limitations & AI Thread Management - **MAXIMUM 4-5 PROMPTS** per task - AI consistency degrades after this point (proven on other workstations) - **PROMPT COUNTING**: User prompts count as 1 each - **MANDATORY PROMPT TRACKING**: AI MUST count user prompts and announce count in each response - **CURRENT PROMPT COUNT**: This is prompt #1 for the current chat session ### Zencoder Configuration & Context Management - **ZENCODER LIMIT WARNINGS**: Zencoder is configured to warn when approaching context limits - **WARNING PROTOCOL**: When zencoder warns about approaching limits: - **DO NOT RESTART** the chat session - **CONTINUE FROM CURRENT POINT** - maintain context and progress - **NOTE**: Every code execution/tool use adds to the token count - **STRATEGY**: Minimize unnecessary tool calls when near limits - **FOCUS**: Complete current task efficiently without expanding scope ### Zencoder Rules & Standards - **CSS NAMING**: Use existing theme system classes (.feature-card, .btn-primary, etc.) - **CODE RETURNS**: Always return complete, functional code blocks - **FILE STRUCTURE**: Follow existing Catalyst/Perl conventions - **DOCUMENTATION**: All docs must be .tt files with proper PageVersion headers - **COMMIT MESSAGES**: Use structured format for consistency ### Thread Degradation Signs & 4th Prompt Protocol - **DEGRADATION SIGNS**: - AI starts making assumptions about unseen code - AI creates unnecessary test files instead of direct fixes - AI loses focus on the specific problem - AI starts "hallucinating" about file contents or structures - **CRITICAL 4TH PROMPT PROTOCOL**: On the 4th user prompt, AI MUST: 1. **UPDATE THIS GUIDELINES FILE** with current task context and lessons learned 2. **PROVIDE HANDOFF INFORMATION** using the template below in a formatted box for easy copy-paste ### HANDOFF TEMPLATE (Use this exact format): ``` === NEXT CHAT SESSION HANDOFF === TASK: [Brief task description] STATUS: [IN PROGRESS/TESTING NEEDED/BLOCKED] PROMPT COUNT: Starting at #1 for new chat PROBLEM STATEMENT: [Exact description of what needs to be fixed/implemented] COMPLETED THIS SESSION: - [List specific accomplishments] - [Files modified with brief description] REMAINING TASKS: 1. [Next specific step needed] 2. [Any additional steps] FILES MODIFIED: - /path/to/file.pm - [what was changed] - /path/to/template.tt - [what was changed] WHAT NOT TO DO: - [Specific mistakes to avoid] - [Approaches that failed] CRITICAL NOTES: - [Any important context for next AI] - [Specific requirements or constraints] NEXT AI INSTRUCTIONS: 1. Read AI_DEVELOPMENT_GUIDELINES.tt first 2. Count prompts starting from #1 3. [Specific first action needed] ``` ### Completion & Status Protocols - **COMPLETION PROTOCOL**: - **NEVER mark tasks as COMPLETED** until user explicitly confirms the fix works - **ALWAYS mark as IN PROGRESS** until user verification - **USER CONFIRMATION REQUIRED** before changing status from ONGOING to COMPLETED - **GUIDELINES UPDATE REQUIREMENT**: Always update the "CURRENT TASK CONTEXT" section with: - Current problem being solved - Progress made - Files modified - Issues encountered - Next steps needed - When updating this file remove all the Completed tasks ### Testing Constraints - **NO EXTERNAL TEST FILES** - test within application only - **NO STANDALONE SCRIPTS** - Catalyst app has auto-restart on code changes - **STANDALONE SCRIPTS for testing functions** - maybe used but must be removed after testing - **FOCUS ON DIRECT FIXES** - Don't waste prompts on analysis, fix the code directly - **NO SYNTAX-ONLY TEST SCRIPTS** - Don't create scripts that just check if methods exist or syntax is valid - **NO MOCK TESTING OUTSIDE APPLICATION** - Testing should be done within the actual application context - **IMPLEMENT ERROR HANDLING IN APPLICATION** - Instead of testing, add proper error handling and graceful degradation ### Application Testing Protocol - Catalyst development server auto-restarts on file changes - Local test scripts often pass but application tests fail - **ALWAYS TEST WITHIN THE APPLICATION CONTEXT** - Never attempt to run development server in chat (will always fail) ## 📁 FILE STRUCTURE & NAMING STANDARDS ### Documentation System Architecture - **PURE DIRECTORY-BASED SYSTEM** - No JSON config files to maintain - **Directory structure determines categorization** automatically - **File placement determines access permissions** and visibility - **Self-organizing** - new files automatically indexed based on location ### Directory Structure Standards ``` /Documentation/ ├── changelog/ # System changes and updates (admin, developer) ├── roles/ │ ├── normal/ # End-user documentation (normal, editor, admin, developer) │ ├── admin/ # Administrator guides (admin, developer) │ └── developer/ # Technical documentation (developer only) ├── sites/ │ └── {site_name}/ # Site-specific documentation ├── modules/ # System module documentation (admin, developer) ├── controllers/ # Controller documentation (admin, developer) ├── models/ # Model documentation (admin, developer) ├── tutorials/ # Step-by-step guides (all roles) ├── proxmox/ # Proxmox documentation (admin only) └── [root files] # General documentation (all roles) ``` ### Template Files (.tt) - **ALL DOCUMENTATION** must be .tt files (not .md) - Follow existing naming conventions exactly - **MANDATORY PageVersion headers**: `[% PageVersion = 'Comserv/root/Documentation/path/file.tt,v 0.01 YYYY/MM/DD author Exp author ' %]` - **ALWAYS update PageVersion path** when moving files - Include debug mode check: `[% IF c.session.debug_mode == 1 %]` ### CSS Management - CRITICAL THEME SYSTEM RULES - **NO MODULE-SPECIFIC CSS STYLING** - NEVER create or modify module CSS for styling - **USE STANDARD CLASSES ONLY** - All styling comes from base-containers.css - **NO INLINE CSS ALLOWED** - causes inconsistent styling - **THEME SYSTEM HIERARCHY**: 1. `base-containers.css` - Universal container and component styles (USE THESE) 2. Theme CSS files (`/static/css/themes/`) - Site-specific color variables ONLY 3. Module CSS - Functionality ONLY, NO styling - **MANDATORY**: Read `/Documentation/developer/theme_system_normalization` before any styling work - **STANDARD CONTAINER CLASSES**: `.feature-card`, `.feature-header`, `.feature-content`, `.feature-actions` - **STANDARD BUTTON CLASSES**: `.btn`, `.btn-primary`, `.btn-secondary`, `.btn-success`, etc. - **WHEN IN DOUBT**: Ask permission before creating ANY new CSS ### Controller Standards - Use `log_with_details` method for all logging - Follow existing route naming patterns - Maintain consistency with existing controller structure ## 🎨 THEME SYSTEM COMPLIANCE ### CSS Variables (use existing) ```css --primary-color, --secondary-color, --success-color, --danger-color --warning-color, --text-color, --bg-color, --card-bg, --border-color ``` ### Common Classes (reuse existing) ```css .feature-card, .admin-card, .feature-grid, .admin-grid .btn, .btn-primary, .btn-secondary, .search-input, .search-button ``` ## 🔧 KNOWN ISSUES TO AVOID ### Documentation Controller - Filename: `Documentation.pm` (correct spelling) - Package: `Comserv::Controller::Documentation` - Routes work: `/Documentation/` (capital D) ### Template Integration - Use existing template includes and structure - Check for missing template dependencies - Follow existing INCLUDE patterns ## 📋 CURRENT TASK CONTEXT ### CURRENT ACTIVE TASK: **TODO ADD PROJECT BUTTON** 🔄 **IN PROGRESS** (2025-07-30) **CURRENT CHAT SESSION**: Implementation session **PROMPT COUNT**: This is prompt #4 for current chat session **GOAL**: Add "Add Project" button next to project selection in both todo add and modify forms **PROGRESS MADE**: - ✅ Modified addtodo.tt template to include "Add Project" button with JavaScript - ✅ Modified details.tt template to replace simple project_id input with dropdown and "Add Project" button - ✅ Added JavaScript functions to open project creation form in popup window - ✅ Modified add_project.tt template to notify parent window on successful project creation - ✅ Updated Todo controller details action to fetch and pass projects list to template - ✅ Added add_project route in Todo controller that forwards to Project controller **REMAINING TASKS**: 1. Test the functionality to ensure popup opens correctly 2. Verify project list refreshes after new project creation 3. Update documentation if needed **RECENTLY COMPLETED TASK**: **TODO MODIFY ERROR FIX** ✅ **FULLY COMPLETED WITH DOCUMENTATION** (2025-07-30) - **Goal**: Fix "/todo/modify/131 An error occurred while updating the record" error - **Root Cause**: Empty string being passed to time_of_day field (MySQL time column rejects empty strings) - **Solution**: Fixed modify action to convert empty time_of_day strings to undef (NULL) - **Status**: ✅ **FULLY COMPLETED** - Code fix + Documentation + Changelog + Cross-references **COMPLETED ACROSS CHAT SESSIONS**: - ✅ **Code Fix**: Fixed modify action to convert empty time_of_day strings to undef (NULL) - ✅ **Enhanced Validation**: Added integer field validation and error handling - ✅ **User Testing**: User confirmed /todo/modify/131 now works without errors - ✅ **Documentation Update**: Updated AI_DEVELOPMENT_GUIDELINES.tt with task context - ✅ **Changelog Creation**: Created detailed changelog entry (2025-07-30-todo-time-field-fix.tt) - ✅ **Main Changelog Update**: Added entry to main CHANGELOG.tt - ✅ **Cross-References**: Added troubleshooting section to TODO_SYSTEM_DOCUMENTATION.tt **FILES MODIFIED**: - `/Comserv/lib/Comserv/Controller/Todo.pm` - Fixed modify action time field handling and validation - `/Comserv/root/Documentation/AI_DEVELOPMENT_GUIDELINES.tt` - Updated task context and guidelines - `/CHANGELOG.tt` - Added Todo Time Field Fix entry to Unreleased section - `/Comserv/root/Documentation/changelog/2025-07-30-todo-time-field-fix.tt` - Detailed changelog entry - `/Comserv/root/Documentation/TODO_SYSTEM_DOCUMENTATION.tt` - Added troubleshooting section with fix details **WHAT NOT TO DO (AVOID PREVIOUS MISTAKES)**: - Don't modify COMPONENT methods to access other models during initialization - causes "Can't use string as HASH ref" errors - Don't ignore prompt counting requirements - always announce prompt count - Don't waste prompts on analysis - focus on implementation first - Don't create new files without permission - update existing code - Don't assume column names without checking schema files - causes "Unknown column" SQL errors - Don't ignore NOT NULL constraints when handling optional form fields - causes constraint violations - Don't forget to update documentation and create changelog entries when tasks are completed - Don't pass empty strings to MySQL time/date columns - always convert to undef (NULL) for nullable fields **LESSONS LEARNED FROM COMPLETED TASK**: - Task completion requires: code fix + documentation update + changelog entry + cross-references - Documentation maintenance is essential part of task completion protocol - Time field handling in MySQL requires special attention to empty string vs NULL conversion - Proper cross-referencing helps future developers understand fixes and context ### COMMIT MESSAGE TEMPLATE (Use this exact format): ``` [TASK TYPE]: [Brief description] Problem: [What issue was being solved] Solution: [What was implemented/fixed] Files Modified: - /path/to/file.pm - [specific change made] - /path/to/template.tt - [specific change made] Status: [IN PROGRESS/COMPLETED/TESTING NEEDED] Next: [What needs to happen next] ``` ### SUCCESS PATTERNS (What works well): - **Implementation first approach** - Start coding immediately, ask for files as needed - **Prompt counting discipline** - Consistent tracking prevents degradation - **Structured handoffs** - Using templates ensures continuity between chats - **Focus on specific fixes** - Avoid broad analysis, target exact problems - **Use existing code patterns** - Follow established Catalyst/Perl conventions --- ## 🔄 END OF CURRENT TASK CONTEXT

autoAppliedRules.name: Repository Information Overview
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Comserv Project Information

## Summary
Comserv is a comprehensive web-based system for managing business operations, projects, and documentation. It's built using the Catalyst Perl web framework and provides features for project management, theme customization, and user authentication.

## Structure
- `Comserv/`: Main application directory containing the core application code
  - `lib/`: Application code and models
  - `docs/`: Documentation files
  - `root/`: Static assets and templates
  - `script/`: Utility scripts for server management and database operations
  - `t/`: Test files
- `app/`: Additional application components
- `data/`: Data files including pricing information
- `proxmox/`: Proxmox VE integration components

## Language & Runtime
**Language**: Perl
**Version**: 5.x (compatible with Perl 5.40.0)
**Framework**: Catalyst 5.90130
**Build System**: Module::Install
**Package Manager**: CPAN

## Dependencies
**Main Dependencies**:
- Catalyst::Runtime (5.90130)
- Moose
- DBIx::Class
- Template (Template Toolkit)
- JSON/JSON::MaybeXS
- Log::Log4perl
- DateTime
- File::Slurp

**Development Dependencies**:
- Test::More (0.88+)
- Test::Pod
- Test::Pod::Coverage
- Test::WWW::Mechanize::Catalyst
- Catalyst::Devel

## Build & Installation
```bash
cd Comserv
perl Makefile.PL
make
make test
make install
```

## Database
**Type**: MySQL
**Setup**: 
```bash
mysql -u root -p < database_initialization_script.sql
```
**Schema Management**: DBIx::Class::Schema::Loader

## Testing
**Framework**: Test::More
**Test Location**: Comserv/t/
**Run Command**:
```bash
cd Comserv
prove -l t/
```

## Server Execution
**Development Server**:
```bash
cd Comserv
script/comserv_server.pl
```
**Production Deployment**:
```bash
cd Comserv
script/comserv_fastcgi.pl
# or
starman --port 5000 --workers 5 comserv.psgi
```

## Authentication & Authorization
- Session-based authentication
- Role-based access control
- Multiple authentication realms
- Support for user groups and site-specific permissions

## Features
- Project management system
- Theme customization system
- Email integration
- PDF generation
- Proxmox VE integration
- Multi-site support

autoAppliedRules.name: Database Development Standards and Best Practices
autoAppliedRules.description: Database Development Standards and Best Practices
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Database Development Standards

## Query Standards
- **Table Aliases:** Use table aliases in all queries to avoid ambiguity (e.g., 'me.column_name')
- **Error Handling:** Implement proper error handling with eval blocks and try/catch
- **Parameterized Queries:** Use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection

## Schema Management
- **Naming Conventions:** Follow naming conventions for tables, columns, and relationships
- **Documentation:** Document schema changes and rationale for future reference
- **Performance:** Regularly optimize database performance and indexes
- **Version Control:** Use Git to track schema changes with proper tagging
- **Backup Protocol:** Always backup database before making schema changes

## Model Standards (DBIx::Class)
- **Result Classes:** Located in `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/lib/Comserv/Model/Schema/Ency/Result/`
- **Relationships:** Define proper relationships between tables
- **Validation:** Implement data validation in model classes

## Configuration Priority
- **Primary:** ZeroTier production server (172.30.161.222) - works from any network
- **Secondary:** Local network production server (192.168.1.198) - home/office only
- **Tertiary:** localhost MySQL (development)
- **Fallback:** SQLite (offline mode)

## Security Protocols
- **Input Validation:** Validate all user inputs before database operations
- **Access Controls:** Implement proper access controls based on user roles
- **Regular Reviews:** Regularly review and update security protocols

autoAppliedRules.name: Template Toolkit Standards and Requirements
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Template Toolkit (.tt) Standards

## Required PageVersion Header Format
All .tt files must include this exact format:
```
[% META title = 'Page Title Here' %]
[% PageVersion = 'relative/path/filename.tt,v 0.01 YYYY/MM/DD author Exp author ' %]
[% IF c.session.debug_mode == 1 %]
    [% PageVersion %]
[% END %]
```

## Template Standards
- **Theme Compliance:** Use theme system variables for styling - NO page-specific CSS
- **Debug Mode:** Include debug mode blocks for development visibility
- **Responsive Design:** Implement mobile-first responsive design patterns
- **HTML Structure:** Use proper semantic HTML structure
- **Template Toolkit:** Follow Template Toolkit best practices

## Navigation Integration
When working with navigation templates:
- **Main Navigation:** Include via `/Navigation/navigation.tt`
- **Admin Menu:** Use `/Navigation/admintopmenu.tt` for admin-only sections
- **Dropdown Menus:** Reference existing dropdown templates in `/Navigation/` directory

## Documentation File Rules - CRITICAL
- **File Format:** ONLY `.tt` files for application documentation - NO `.md` files
- **EXISTING FILES FIRST:** ALWAYS search for and use existing files before creating new ones
- **Naming Consistency:** Use same file names across AI sessions to prevent content loss
- **Content Priority:** Always improve existing files rather than creating new ones
- **Role-Based Access:** Respect existing Documentation/index.tt role-based structure
- **Directory Consolidation:** Use established directory structure - don't create new directories

## File Creation Protocol
1. **Search First:** Use file search tools to find existing similar files
2. **Check Directory:** Look at existing directory structure in target location
3. **Ask User:** If multiple similar files exist, ask which should be updated
4. **Update Existing:** Improve existing files rather than creating duplicates

## Documentation Configuration Management - CRITICAL
When adding new documentation files (.tt):
- **ALWAYS update:** `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/root/Documentation/config/documentation_config.json`
- **NEVER update:** `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/root/Documentation/documentation_config.json` (legacy file)
- **Required fields:** id, title, description, path, categories, roles, site, format
- **Format:** "template" for .tt files, "markdown" for .md files
- **Categories:** Use existing categories: user_guides, admin_guides, developer_guides, tutorials, modules, controllers, models, changelog, proxmox, documentation, templates
- **Roles:** ["developer", "admin"] for technical docs, ["normal", "editor", "admin", "developer"] for user docs

autoAppliedRules.name: AI Behavior Enforcement Rules for Zencoder
autoAppliedRules.description: AI Behavior Enforcement Rules for Zencoder
autoAppliedRules.content:
# AI Behavior Enforcement Rules

## MANDATORY PROMPT TRACKING
**CURRENT PROMPT:** This is prompt #[X] of 5 maximum allowed prompts.

### Prompt Counter Protocol
- **Start Each Response:** Begin every response with current prompt count
- **Track Internally:** Keep running count throughout conversation
- **Warn at Prompt 4:** Alert user that next prompt will trigger handoff
- **Stop at Prompt 5:** Refuse to continue, provide handoff documentation

## MANDATORY APPROVAL WORKFLOW

### Before ANY Code Changes
1. **STOP:** Do not modify any files without explicit user approval
2. **PRESENT:** Show exactly what will be changed using the standard format
3. **WAIT:** Wait for explicit approval ("yes", "approved", "apply changes")
4. **CONFIRM:** Acknowledge approval before proceeding
5. **EXECUTE:** Apply changes only after confirmation

### Standard Change Presentation
```
🔄 PROPOSED CHANGE TO: [filename]
📝 CHANGE TYPE: [Addition/Modification/Deletion]
📋 DESCRIPTION: [what this accomplishes]

❌ CURRENT CODE:
[existing code or "N/A"]

✅ NEW CODE:
[proposed code or "DELETED"]

💡 REASON: [why needed]

⚠️  APPROVAL REQUIRED: Please confirm with "approved" or "yes"
🔄 REVERT: Changes can be undone if needed
```

## VIOLATION CONSEQUENCES
- **Prompt Limit Exceeded:** Immediate session termination with handoff
- **Unapproved Changes:** Acknowledge violation and request approval retroactively
- **Missing Counter:** Add prompt counter to current response

## HANDOFF TEMPLATE (Use on 5th Prompt)
```
🚨 PROMPT LIMIT REACHED - HANDOFF REQUIRED

📊 SESSION SUMMARY:
- Prompts Used: 5/5
- Files Modified: [list]
- Tasks Completed: [list]
- Tasks Remaining: [list]

🔄 HANDOFF PROMPT FOR NEXT AI:
"Continue working on [project/task]. Read development-guidelines.md and ai-behavior-enforcement.md first. 
Current context: [brief context]
Files being worked on: [list]
Next steps needed: [specific actions]"

📚 REQUIRED READING FOR NEXT AI:
- .zencoder/rules/development-guidelines.md
- .zencoder/rules/ai-behavior-enforcement.md
- [any other relevant docs]

✅ DOCUMENTATION UPDATED: [what was recorded]
```

## EMERGENCY PROTOCOLS
- **User Says "Stop":** Immediately cease all activities
- **User Says "Revert":** Provide instructions for undoing changes
- **User Says "Handoff":** Immediately provide handoff documentation

let go with 2. but that is not the beast way to return code  +- format when applying the changes is what used to be done and it worked well for me. With the limitations of the ide it is not possible to compare changes line by line to understand what is being done.

you approach, though good logging is imparative, dose not seem to have been based on reading the documentation my inistial prompt Saying basicly that the code worked as desired then you make an unrealted change and we have to return to fixing the same error again. That is the reason we do any documentation at all not reading it leads to have to solve the problem again.

**ALWAYS update PageVersion path** when moving files - Include debug mode check: `[% IF c.session.debug_mode == 1 %]` ### CSS Management - CRITICAL THEME SYSTEM RULES - **NO MODULE-SPECIFIC CSS STYLING** - NEVER create or modify module CSS for styling - **USE STANDARD CLASSES ONLY** - All styling comes from base-containers.css - **NO INLINE CSS ALLOWED** - causes inconsistent styling - **THEME SYSTEM HIERARCHY**: 1. `base-containers.css` - Universal container and component styles (USE THESE) 2. Theme CSS files (`/static/css/themes/`) - Site-specific color variables ONLY 3. Module CSS - Functionality ONLY, NO styling - **MANDATORY**: Read `/Documentation/developer/theme_system_normalization` before any styling work - **STANDARD CONTAINER CLASSES**: `.feature-card`, `.feature-header`, `.feature-content`, `.feature-actions` - **STANDARD BUTTON CLASSES**: `.btn`, `.btn-primary`, `.btn-secondary`, `.btn-success`, etc. - **WHEN IN DOUBT**: Ask permission before creating ANY new CSS ### Controller Standards - Use `log_with_details` method for all logging - Follow existing route naming patterns - Maintain consistency with existing controller structure ## 🎨 THEME SYSTEM COMPLIANCE ### CSS Variables (use existing) ```css --primary-color, --secondary-color, --success-color, --danger-color --warning-color, --text-color, --bg-color, --card-bg, --border-color ``` ### Common Classes (reuse existing) ```css .feature-card, .admin-card, .feature-grid, .admin-grid .btn, .btn-primary, .btn-secondary, .search-input, .search-button ``` ## 🔧 KNOWN ISSUES TO AVOID ### Documentation Controller - Filename: `Documentation.pm` (correct spelling) - Package: `Comserv::Controller::Documentation` - Routes work: `/Documentation/` (capital D) ### Template Integration - Use existing template includes and structure - Check for missing template dependencies - Follow existing INCLUDE patterns ## 📋 CURRENT TASK CONTEXT ### CURRENT ACTIVE TASK: **TODO ADD PROJECT BUTTON** 🔄 **IN PROGRESS** (2025-07-30) **CURRENT CHAT SESSION**: Implementation session **PROMPT COUNT**: This is prompt #4 for current chat session **GOAL**: Add "Add Project" button next to project selection in both todo add and modify forms **PROGRESS MADE**: - ✅ Modified addtodo.tt template to include "Add Project" button with JavaScript - ✅ Modified details.tt template to replace simple project_id input with dropdown and "Add Project" button - ✅ Added JavaScript functions to open project creation form in popup window - ✅ Modified add_project.tt template to notify parent window on successful project creation - ✅ Updated Todo controller details action to fetch and pass projects list to template - ✅ Added add_project route in Todo controller that forwards to Project controller **REMAINING TASKS**: 1. Test the functionality to ensure popup opens correctly 2. Verify project list refreshes after new project creation 3. Update documentation if needed **RECENTLY COMPLETED TASK**: **TODO MODIFY ERROR FIX** ✅ **FULLY COMPLETED WITH DOCUMENTATION** (2025-07-30) - **Goal**: Fix "/todo/modify/131 An error occurred while updating the record" error - **Root Cause**: Empty string being passed to time_of_day field (MySQL time column rejects empty strings) - **Solution**: Fixed modify action to convert empty time_of_day strings to undef (NULL) - **Status**: ✅ **FULLY COMPLETED** - Code fix + Documentation + Changelog + Cross-references **COMPLETED ACROSS CHAT SESSIONS**: - ✅ **Code Fix**: Fixed modify action to convert empty time_of_day strings to undef (NULL) - ✅ **Enhanced Validation**: Added integer field validation and error handling - ✅ **User Testing**: User confirmed /todo/modify/131 now works without errors - ✅ **Documentation Update**: Updated AI_DEVELOPMENT_GUIDELINES.tt with task context - ✅ **Changelog Creation**: Created detailed changelog entry (2025-07-30-todo-time-field-fix.tt) - ✅ **Main Changelog Update**: Added entry to main CHANGELOG.tt - ✅ **Cross-References**: Added troubleshooting section to TODO_SYSTEM_DOCUMENTATION.tt **FILES MODIFIED**: - `/Comserv/lib/Comserv/Controller/Todo.pm` - Fixed modify action time field handling and validation - `/Comserv/root/Documentation/AI_DEVELOPMENT_GUIDELINES.tt` - Updated task context and guidelines - `/CHANGELOG.tt` - Added Todo Time Field Fix entry to Unreleased section - `/Comserv/root/Documentation/changelog/2025-07-30-todo-time-field-fix.tt` - Detailed changelog entry - `/Comserv/root/Documentation/TODO_SYSTEM_DOCUMENTATION.tt` - Added troubleshooting section with fix details **WHAT NOT TO DO (AVOID PREVIOUS MISTAKES)**: - Don't modify COMPONENT methods to access other models during initialization - causes "Can't use string as HASH ref" errors - Don't ignore prompt counting requirements - always announce prompt count - Don't waste prompts on analysis - focus on implementation first - Don't create new files without permission - update existing code - Don't assume column names without checking schema files - causes "Unknown column" SQL errors - Don't ignore NOT NULL constraints when handling optional form fields - causes constraint violations - Don't forget to update documentation and create changelog entries when tasks are completed - Don't pass empty strings to MySQL time/date columns - always convert to undef (NULL) for nullable fields **LESSONS LEARNED FROM COMPLETED TASK**: - Task completion requires: code fix + documentation update + changelog entry + cross-references - Documentation maintenance is essential part of task completion protocol - Time field handling in MySQL requires special attention to empty string vs NULL conversion - Proper cross-referencing helps future developers understand fixes and context ### COMMIT MESSAGE TEMPLATE (Use this exact format): ``` [TASK TYPE]: [Brief description] Problem: [What issue was being solved] Solution: [What was implemented/fixed] Files Modified: - /path/to/file.pm - [specific change made] - /path/to/template.tt - [specific change made] Status: [IN PROGRESS/COMPLETED/TESTING NEEDED] Next: [What needs to happen next] ``` ### SUCCESS PATTERNS (What works well): - **Implementation first approach** - Start coding immediately, ask for files as needed - **Prompt counting discipline** - Consistent tracking prevents degradation - **Structured handoffs** - Using templates ensures continuity between chats - **Focus on specific fixes** - Avoid broad analysis, target exact problems - **Use existing code patterns** - Follow established Catalyst/Perl conventions --- ## 🔄 END OF CURRENT TASK CONTEXT

autoAppliedRules.name: Repository Information Overview
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Comserv Project Information

## Summary
Comserv is a comprehensive web-based system for managing business operations, projects, and documentation. It's built using the Catalyst Perl web framework and provides features for project management, theme customization, and user authentication.

## Structure
- `Comserv/`: Main application directory containing the core application code
  - `lib/`: Application code and models
  - `docs/`: Documentation files
  - `root/`: Static assets and templates
  - `script/`: Utility scripts for server management and database operations
  - `t/`: Test files
- `app/`: Additional application components
- `data/`: Data files including pricing information
- `proxmox/`: Proxmox VE integration components

## Language & Runtime
**Language**: Perl
**Version**: 5.x (compatible with Perl 5.40.0)
**Framework**: Catalyst 5.90130
**Build System**: Module::Install
**Package Manager**: CPAN

## Dependencies
**Main Dependencies**:
- Catalyst::Runtime (5.90130)
- Moose
- DBIx::Class
- Template (Template Toolkit)
- JSON/JSON::MaybeXS
- Log::Log4perl
- DateTime
- File::Slurp

**Development Dependencies**:
- Test::More (0.88+)
- Test::Pod
- Test::Pod::Coverage
- Test::WWW::Mechanize::Catalyst
- Catalyst::Devel

## Build & Installation
```bash
cd Comserv
perl Makefile.PL
make
make test
make install
```

## Database
**Type**: MySQL
**Setup**: 
```bash
mysql -u root -p < database_initialization_script.sql
```
**Schema Management**: DBIx::Class::Schema::Loader

## Testing
**Framework**: Test::More
**Test Location**: Comserv/t/
**Run Command**:
```bash
cd Comserv
prove -l t/
```

## Server Execution
**Development Server**:
```bash
cd Comserv
script/comserv_server.pl
```
**Production Deployment**:
```bash
cd Comserv
script/comserv_fastcgi.pl
# or
starman --port 5000 --workers 5 comserv.psgi
```

## Authentication & Authorization
- Session-based authentication
- Role-based access control
- Multiple authentication realms
- Support for user groups and site-specific permissions

## Features
- Project management system
- Theme customization system
- Email integration
- PDF generation
- Proxmox VE integration
- Multi-site support

autoAppliedRules.name: Database Development Standards and Best Practices
autoAppliedRules.description: Database Development Standards and Best Practices
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Database Development Standards

## Query Standards
- **Table Aliases:** Use table aliases in all queries to avoid ambiguity (e.g., 'me.column_name')
- **Error Handling:** Implement proper error handling with eval blocks and try/catch
- **Parameterized Queries:** Use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection

## Schema Management
- **Naming Conventions:** Follow naming conventions for tables, columns, and relationships
- **Documentation:** Document schema changes and rationale for future reference
- **Performance:** Regularly optimize database performance and indexes
- **Version Control:** Use Git to track schema changes with proper tagging
- **Backup Protocol:** Always backup database before making schema changes

## Model Standards (DBIx::Class)
- **Result Classes:** Located in `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/lib/Comserv/Model/Schema/Ency/Result/`
- **Relationships:** Define proper relationships between tables
- **Validation:** Implement data validation in model classes

## Configuration Priority
- **Primary:** ZeroTier production server (172.30.161.222) - works from any network
- **Secondary:** Local network production server (192.168.1.198) - home/office only
- **Tertiary:** localhost MySQL (development)
- **Fallback:** SQLite (offline mode)

## Security Protocols
- **Input Validation:** Validate all user inputs before database operations
- **Access Controls:** Implement proper access controls based on user roles
- **Regular Reviews:** Regularly review and update security protocols

autoAppliedRules.name: Template Toolkit Standards and Requirements
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Template Toolkit (.tt) Standards

## Required PageVersion Header Format
All .tt files must include this exact format:
```
[% META title = 'Page Title Here' %]
[% PageVersion = 'relative/path/filename.tt,v 0.01 YYYY/MM/DD author Exp author ' %]
[% IF c.session.debug_mode == 1 %]
    [% PageVersion %]
[% END %]
```

## Template Standards
- **Theme Compliance:** Use theme system variables for styling - NO page-specific CSS
- **Debug Mode:** Include debug mode blocks for development visibility
- **Responsive Design:** Implement mobile-first responsive design patterns
- **HTML Structure:** Use proper semantic HTML structure
- **Template Toolkit:** Follow Template Toolkit best practices

## Navigation Integration
When working with navigation templates:
- **Main Navigation:** Include via `/Navigation/navigation.tt`
- **Admin Menu:** Use `/Navigation/admintopmenu.tt` for admin-only sections
- **Dropdown Menus:** Reference existing dropdown templates in `/Navigation/` directory

## Documentation File Rules - CRITICAL
- **File Format:** ONLY `.tt` files for application documentation - NO `.md` files
- **EXISTING FILES FIRST:** ALWAYS search for and use existing files before creating new ones
- **Naming Consistency:** Use same file names across AI sessions to prevent content loss
- **Content Priority:** Always improve existing files rather than creating new ones
- **Role-Based Access:** Respect existing Documentation/index.tt role-based structure
- **Directory Consolidation:** Use established directory structure - don't create new directories

## File Creation Protocol
1. **Search First:** Use file search tools to find existing similar files
2. **Check Directory:** Look at existing directory structure in target location
3. **Ask User:** If multiple similar files exist, ask which should be updated
4. **Update Existing:** Improve existing files rather than creating duplicates

## Documentation Configuration Management - CRITICAL
When adding new documentation files (.tt):
- **ALWAYS update:** `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/root/Documentation/config/documentation_config.json`
- **NEVER update:** `/home/shanta/PycharmProjects/comserv2/Comserv/root/Documentation/documentation_config.json` (legacy file)
- **Required fields:** id, title, description, path, categories, roles, site, format
- **Format:** "template" for .tt files, "markdown" for .md files
- **Categories:** Use existing categories: user_guides, admin_guides, developer_guides, tutorials, modules, controllers, models, changelog, proxmox, documentation, templates
- **Roles:** ["developer", "admin"] for technical docs, ["normal", "editor", "admin", "developer"] for user docs

autoAppliedRules.name: AI Behavior Enforcement Rules for Zencoder
autoAppliedRules.description: AI Behavior Enforcement Rules for Zencoder
autoAppliedRules.content:
# AI Behavior Enforcement Rules

## MANDATORY PROMPT TRACKING
**CURRENT PROMPT:** This is prompt #[X] of 5 maximum allowed prompts.

### Prompt Counter Protocol
- **Start Each Response:** Begin every response with current prompt count
- **Track Internally:** Keep running count throughout conversation
- **Warn at Prompt 4:** Alert user that next prompt will trigger handoff
- **Stop at Prompt 5:** Refuse to continue, provide handoff documentation

## MANDATORY APPROVAL WORKFLOW

### Before ANY Code Changes
1. **STOP:** Do not modify any files without explicit user approval
2. **PRESENT:** Show exactly what will be changed using the standard format
3. **WAIT:** Wait for explicit approval ("yes", "approved", "apply changes")
4. **CONFIRM:** Acknowledge approval before proceeding
5. **EXECUTE:** Apply changes only after confirmation

### Standard Change Presentation
```
🔄 PROPOSED CHANGE TO: [filename]
📝 CHANGE TYPE: [Addition/Modification/Deletion]
📋 DESCRIPTION: [what this accomplishes]

❌ CURRENT CODE:
[existing code or "N/A"]

✅ NEW CODE:
[proposed code or "DELETED"]

💡 REASON: [why needed]

⚠️  APPROVAL REQUIRED: Please confirm with "approved" or "yes"
🔄 REVERT: Changes can be undone if needed
```

## VIOLATION CONSEQUENCES
- **Prompt Limit Exceeded:** Immediate session termination with handoff
- **Unapproved Changes:** Acknowledge violation and request approval retroactively
- **Missing Counter:** Add prompt counter to current response

## HANDOFF TEMPLATE (Use on 5th Prompt)
```
🚨 PROMPT LIMIT REACHED - HANDOFF REQUIRED

📊 SESSION SUMMARY:
- Prompts Used: 5/5
- Files Modified: [list]
- Tasks Completed: [list]
- Tasks Remaining: [list]

🔄 HANDOFF PROMPT FOR NEXT AI:
"Continue working on [project/task]. Read development-guidelines.md and ai-behavior-enforcement.md first. 
Current context: [brief context]
Files being worked on: [list]
Next steps needed: [specific actions]"

📚 REQUIRED READING FOR NEXT AI:
- .zencoder/rules/development-guidelines.md
- .zencoder/rules/ai-behavior-enforcement.md
- [any other relevant docs]

✅ DOCUMENTATION UPDATED: [what was recorded]
```

## EMERGENCY PROTOCOLS
- **User Says "Stop":** Immediately cease all activities
- **User Says "Revert":** Provide instructions for undoing changes
- **User Says "Handoff":** Immediately provide handoff documentation
